Users may need help with specific healthcare-related issues.
Hospital bills can be very high, even if you have insurance.
Hospital bills often contain errors and lack discount opportunities.
Concerns about being charged unfairly.
Difficulty understanding complex medical bills.
Presence of coding errors in bills.
Stress and hopelessness from medical bills and debt.
Hospitals being uncooperative or denying disputes.
Outrageous charges for medical services.
Nearly every hospital bill is negotiable, but the process is stressful and time-consuming for individuals.
The bill you receive in the mail usually hides errors and inflated charges.
The healthcare system lacks transparency.
It's difficult to get a clear price estimate for medical services.
Medical records are often inaccessible or hard to navigate.
People go toe-to-toe with the healthcare system.
Our healthcare system doesn't exactly scream transparency.
No one can really give you a price estimate.
Medical records are filed away in dusty cabinets.
A lot of Americans are fed up with the healthcare system.
Many eligible hospital discounts (501(r)) are hidden savings that most hospitals are required to offer.

501(r) discounts are healthcare's best-kept savings secret, leading to underutilization despite high eligibility (e.g., 4 in 10 claims reviewed by Goodbill qualify, and a family of 4 with an average income under $128,600 may qualify).
Members need a streamlined and secure way to check eligibility and apply for 501(r) discounts.
Claims may contain overcharges, and 501(r) discounts need to be secured before the plan pays; appeals may be required after provider payment.
Most hospital claims contain inflated charges.
5 in 10 claims we review contain coding errors or unnecessary care.
Coding errors (Upcoding or unbundling, Duplicate charges, Wrong quantities)
Clinically unnecessary care (Inflated severity of condition, Excessive labs or tests, Low-value procedures)
Inflated charges in claims.
Difficulty for members to drive claim savings.
Emotional stress and financial hardship from healthcare bills.
Claims stream before adjudication is not optimized for savings.
Members may not connect their patient portal or check 501(r) eligibility.
Overcharges based on provider notes are not always flagged.
Eligible members may not apply for or secure additional 501(r) discounts.
Claims are not dynamically repriced and edited before payment.
Appeals process needs handling.

Industry professionals need opportunities for ongoing education and networking.
Users may have specific questions or require support related to healthcare transactions or Goodbill's services.

Goodbill aims to build trust and confidence into every health care transaction.
Goodbill negotiates hospital bills for you.
Goodbill reviews your bill for errors and discount opportunities.
Goodbill aims to keep money in your pocket.
The service is 100% free unless savings are found.
Goodbill negotiates hospital bills to significantly reduce costs.
Goodbill reviews billing codes for inaccuracy and provides thorough analysis.
Goodbill advocates on your behalf with medical facilities.
Goodbill identifies and resolves coding errors, leading to waived or reduced bills.
Goodbill makes the process easy and stress-free.
Goodbill ensures you pay a fair price for medical services.
Goodbill provides constant contact and updates throughout the process.
Goodbill offers professional, responsive, and patient customer service.
Goodbill's experts navigate the negotiation process to maximize your savings.
Goodbill's service is 100% free if they don't save you money.
You pay only 20% of what you save.
There are no upfront costs or hidden fees.
The signup process is easy and quick.
Goodbill obtains the correct itemized bill from your hospital.
Goodbill's team of medical coding and billing experts reviews your medical record against your bill to flag suspicious charges.
Goodbill negotiates your hospital bill to achieve the best possible savings.
Goodbill provides regular updates throughout the negotiation process.
Goodbill is on a mission to make healthcare affordable, fair, and transparent for patients.
Goodbill operates with clear values: 'Do it for the patient', 'Sweat the details', and 'Follow through'.
Goodbill prioritizes security and privacy, storing data securely and transmitting it using encryption technology.
Goodbill leverages recent government efforts to make healthcare data accessible online to empower patients.
Goodbill works for the patient.
Goodbill sweats the details.
Goodbill follows through.
Goodbill stores data securely.
Goodbill transmits data using the latest in encryption technology.
Government has done a lot of work to require insurance companies and hospitals to put data online.
It is a ripe time for a business like Goodbill.
Negotiating hospital bills has never been this easy.
Sign up for free to get started.
Goodbill builds trust and confidence into every health care transaction.
Goodbill offers Solutions for Plans including 501(r) Discounts, Claim Reviews, and Member Experience.
Goodbill offers Solutions for Patients including Hospital Bill Negotiations.
Goodbill guides members through the entire 501(r) discount process, from screening, to application, to results, to unlock these hidden savings.
Goodbill 'cracks the code' on 501(r) discounts, ensuring plan sponsors and their members pay the right amount on each claim.

Goodbill provides a one-stop secure portal for members to instantly check eligibility for 3,500+ hospitals, complete automatically started applications, and receive results while Goodbill follows up with the hospital on their behalf.

Goodbill acts as the first stop in the claims stream before adjudication, engaging members to check 501(r) eligibility, using A.I., coders, and clinicians to flag overcharges, securing 501(r) discounts, returning dynamically repriced and edited claims, and handling appeals.
Supercharge your claim reviews for bigger savings
Use A.I., coding and clinical experts, and real visit data to catch errors early before the plan pays the provider.
Capture more savings on every claim
Line-by-line claim reviews to ensure paying only what’s fair

Claim reviews that are precise and fast
Digitally connect to the member’s health record for quick turnarounds

Coders and clinicians review each charge against the member’s health record
Edit, reprice, and return the claim with findings before payment.

Goodbill provides regular updates throughout the negotiation process.

issues: Many eligible hospital discounts (501(r)) are hidden savings that most hospitals are required to offer.
recommendations: Goodbill guides members through the entire 501(r) discount process, from screening, to application, to results, to unlock these hidden savings.

issues: 501(r) discounts are healthcare's best-kept savings secret, leading to underutilization despite high eligibility (e.g., 4 in 10 claims reviewed by Goodbill qualify, and a family of 4 with an average income under $128,600 may qualify).
recommendations: Goodbill 'cracks the code' on 501(r) discounts, ensuring plan sponsors and their members pay the right amount on each claim.

issues: Members need a streamlined and secure way to check eligibility and apply for 501(r) discounts.
recommendations: Goodbill provides a one-stop secure portal for members to instantly check eligibility for 3,500+ hospitals, complete automatically started applications, and receive results while Goodbill follows up with the hospital on their behalf.

issues: Claims may contain overcharges, and 501(r) discounts need to be secured before the plan pays; appeals may be required after provider payment.
recommendations: Goodbill acts as the first stop in the claims stream before adjudication, engaging members to check 501(r) eligibility, using A.I., coders, and clinicians to flag overcharges, securing 501(r) discounts, returning dynamically repriced and edited claims, and handling appeals.
